title: Day 6 | 10to100 Covid Vaccination Challenge
cleaned_text: Getting Back to Normal New Mexico Governor Michelle Lujan Grisham has laid out the plan for reopening New Mexico: the state needs to be 60% fully vaccinated. She believes that will be by the end of June, but we will all have to do it together to achieve this! NM Plans to Reopen if We Get 60% Vaccinated Fully Vaccinated Common Myths MYTH: Since it seems like things are going back to normal, I can stop wearing my mask in public and don't need to distance myself from others anymore. Even as COVID-19 infection rates decrease and vaccination rates increase, we strongly recommend continuing to wear your mask and socially distance, to keep both you and your fellow community members safe as we all get vaccinated. MYTH: Since cities/states seem to be opening back up and people are getting vaccinated, I don't have to be as careful anymore (e.g. limiting where I go, washing hands, etc.) As stated above, please continue to practice safe practices such as staying home, washing your hands, wearing a mask and socially distancing. Get a Vaccine UNM Health will be vaccinating patients at The Pit at the University of New Mexico. To register for a COVID-19 vaccination, visit The New Mexico Department of Health website.
